accesscondition.title: AccessCondition
accesscondition.description: Defines a single boolean predicate evaluated against a request context attribute (field), comparing the runtime value using a specified operator. Composed inside a PolicyRule condition chain to form compound access control expressions.

operator.description: Comparison operator applied to the field value, per XACML 3.0 match function semantics.

accountabilityrequirement.title: AccountabilityRequirement
accountabilityrequirement.description: Expresses who is obligated to provide evidence that a specific action occurred and under what conditions that evidence can be challenged. Distinct from AuditConfig, which defines what events are captured — this node defines the obligation to prove an action took place. Implements NIST SP 800-53 AU-10 non-repudiation.

actor.title: Actor
actor.description: A named principal — human user, service account, automated system, or external entity — whose identity and trust level govern what operations it may perform. Associates with Roles for permission grouping and with SeparationOfDuty and Delegation controls, per NIST SP 800-53 AC-2 (Account Management) and SP 800-207 (Zero Trust Architecture).

type.description: Category of actor, per NIST AC-2 (Account Management) subject classification.

trustLevel.description: Zero-trust assurance level assigned to this actor, per NIST SP 800-207.

objectives.description: References nodes describing this actor's goals or intended behaviors (e.g., for threat modeling or trust analysis).

dependencies.description: References actor or delegation nodes this actor depends on for trust chain or access delegation analysis.

auditconfig.title: AuditConfig
auditconfig.description: Configuration for security audit logging, specifying what events to capture, retention periods, storage destinations, and compliance requirements. Enables security monitoring and forensic analysis.

level.description: Verbosity of audit event capture, from no logging to full payload-level tracing, per NIST SP 800-53 AU-2 Event Logging.

authenticationconfig.title: AuthenticationConfig
authenticationconfig.description: Specifies how principals are verified before accessing protected resources, including the identity provider, multi-factor requirements, session lifetime, and credential policy references. Scoped per application or service. Maps to NIST SP 800-53 IA-2, IA-5, and IA-11.

verificationLevel.description: Identity Assurance Level, per NIST SP 800-63A: IAL1 (self-asserted), IAL2 (remote identity proofing), IAL3 (in-person proofing).

bindingofduty.title: BindingOfDuty
bindingofduty.description: Obligation control requiring that a single actor who initiates a task must also complete it, preventing task hijacking or inconsistent workflow state that could be exploited by a different actor. Complements SeparationOfDuty by enforcing task continuity rather than task segregation. Anchored to NIST SP 800-53 CM-5 (Access Restrictions for Change) and workflow integrity controls.

condition.title: Condition
condition.description: A reusable logical expression evaluated against request context (time, location, user attributes, resource state) to determine when a SecurityPolicy rule applies. Distinct from AccessCondition, which is a concrete field+operator+value predicate composed inside a PolicyRule condition chain.

operator.description: Comparison operator for the condition expression, aligned with XACML MatchType values.

evaluationType.description: When the condition is evaluated: at build time, at policy load, or at runtime during access enforcement.

countermeasure.title: Countermeasure
countermeasure.description: A security control or mitigation technique that reduces the likelihood or impact of a specific threat. Maps to NIST SP 800-53 controls by type (technical, operational, management) and tracks implementation status and residual risk.

type.description: NIST SP 800-53 control family classification: technical (hardware/software mechanisms), operational (people and procedures), management (governance), or physical (facility/environmental).

effectiveness.description: Assessed effectiveness of the countermeasure in reducing threat risk, per NIST SP 800-30 risk treatment evaluation.

encryptionRequirement.description: Minimum encryption obligation for data within this classification scheme, per NIST SP 800-53 SC-28 and SC-8 controls.

classificationLevel.description: Data sensitivity tier applied by this scheme, aligned with NIST FIPS 199 security categorization levels.

delegation.title: Delegation
delegation.description: Explicit transfer of permissions or authority from a delegator to a delegatee, subject to scope constraints and optional time bounds. Supports least-privilege enforcement (NIST AC-6) by enabling time-limited privilege elevation rather than permanent role assignment.

delegationType.description: Scope and constraints of the delegation grant, per OAuth 2.0 token delegation and NIST SP 800-162 attribute delegation models.

validUntil.description: ISO 8601 datetime after which this delegation automatically expires. Required for delegationType 'temporary' and recommended for 'conditional' to enforce time-bounded privilege grants per AC-6.

evidence.title: Evidence
evidence.description: An artifact that provides verifiable proof of an action or event for non-repudiation and audit purposes. Anchored to NIST SP 800-53 AU-10 (Non-repudiation), evidence types range from cryptographic signatures to plain audit log entries, with strength characterizing the assurance level per NIST SP 800-63-3.

type.description: Category of evidence artifact, per NIST AU-10 (Non-repudiation).

strength.description: Assurance strength of the evidence, per NIST SP 800-63-3 assurance levels.

source.description: Origin or location of this evidence artifact, such as a system identifier, log stream name, or storage URI.

fieldaccesscontrol.title: FieldAccessControl
fieldaccesscontrol.description: Defines access restrictions and transformation rules for a specific data field, controlling how sensitive values are masked or redacted when exposed to unauthorized principals. Used within SecureResource fieldAccess to enforce field-level data protection per NIST SP 800-53 AC-3 and SC-28.

maskingStrategy.description: Technique used to protect sensitive field values when exposed to unauthorized principals, per NIST SP 800-53 SC-28 data-at-rest protection controls.

informationentity.title: InformationEntity
informationentity.description: Named information asset subject to fine-grained access rights and data classification. Represents a logical grouping of data (e.g., customer PII, financial records) whose access is governed by associated InformationRight grants and AccountabilityRequirements, per NIST SP 800-53 AC-3 and IP-1.

classification.description: Sensitivity classification of this information asset. Use classificationLevel values: public, internal, confidential, restricted, or top-secret.

authorizationRequirements.description: References InformationRight nodes defining which actors may access this entity and under what constraints.

informationright.title: InformationRight
informationright.description: A granular access grant specifying which operations a named actor may perform on an InformationEntity, subject to a qualifying constraint expression. Implements attribute-based access control (ABAC) at the information asset level, per NIST SP 800-162 (ABAC Guide) and NIST SP 800-53 AC-3(14).

actor.description: Identifier of the actor (security.actor) to whom this right is granted.

constraint.description: Boolean constraint expression that must evaluate to true for the right to apply (e.g., 'actor.department == resource.ownerDepartment').

operations.description: Permitted operations on the information entity granted by this right.

needtoknow.title: NeedToKnow
needtoknow.description: Restricts access to a resource to only those actors whose stated purpose requires it, implementing the NIST SP 800-53 AC-3(3) mandatory access control principle. JustificationRequired enforces that actors must declare their purpose before access is granted.

objective.description: A free-text statement of the business or operational purpose that justifies access. This is a purpose declaration string, not a reference to an ActorObjective node.

passwordpolicy.title: PasswordPolicy
passwordpolicy.description: Defines password complexity, rotation, and lockout requirements for credential-based authentication. Implements NIST SP 800-53 IA-5(1) controls including minimum length, character class requirements, history enforcement, and brute-force lockout thresholds.

permission.title: Permission
permission.description: An atomic grant authorizing a specific action (e.g., read, write, execute) on a resource within a defined scope. Permissions are assigned to Roles and enforced by SecureResource access control lists. Implements NIST SP 800-53 AC-3 access enforcement and AC-6 least privilege.

scope.description: Breadth of access granted by this permission, from narrow read-only to full administrative control.

action.description: CRUD-plus operation type this permission governs, per NIST SP 800-53 AC-3 Access Enforcement.

policyaction.title: PolicyAction
policyaction.description: The enforcement action executed when a SecurityPolicy rule condition is met. Defines the system response to a policy match (allow, deny, remediation, notification), ensuring consistent policy enforcement across the security model per NIST SP 800-53 CA-9 (Internal System Connections) and SI-3 (Malicious Code Protection).

type.description: Enforcement action type applied when the parent policy rule fires.

parameters.description: Key-value configuration for the action (e.g., redirect URL, notification recipient, masking pattern).

policyrule.title: PolicyRule
policyrule.description: An atomic policy evaluation unit consisting of a condition predicate and an enforcement effect (PERMIT or DENY), with optional obligation actions executed upon match. Multiple PolicyRules compose a SecurityPolicy evaluated in priority order.

effect.description: Policy decision outcome, per XACML 3.0 Rule element effect values.

resourceoperation.title: ResourceOperation
resourceoperation.description: A permitted operation that an actor may perform on a secured resource, forming the verb component of a subject-verb-object access control policy. Bound to AccessConditions, RateLimits, and AuditConfig nodes via the security policy model, per NIST SP 800-53 AC-3 (Access Enforcement).

operation.description: Permitted operation type on the secured resource.

conditions.description: References AccessCondition nodes that must be satisfied before this operation is authorized.

rateLimit.description: References RateLimit nodes (api.ratelimit) applied to this operation.

audit.description: References AuditConfig nodes specifying how this operation is logged for accountability.

retentionpolicy.title: RetentionPolicy
retentionpolicy.description: Defines how long security-related data (audit logs, access records, encryption keys) must be retained, archival strategies, and secure deletion procedures. Ensures compliance with regulatory requirements.

destination.description: Storage or forwarding target for retained security data, per NIST SP 800-53 AU-9 Protection of Audit Information.

deletionMethod.description: Secure disposal technique applied when data reaches end of retention period, per NIST SP 800-88 Guidelines for Media Sanitization.

role.title: Role
role.description: A named collection of Permissions implementing RBAC per NIST SP 800-53 AC-2 and AC-6. Roles can inherit from parent roles (role hierarchy), accumulating permissions transitively. The level attribute defines the role privilege tier for least-privilege enforcement.

inheritsFrom.description: Name of the parent role this role inherits permissions from. Supports single inheritance; the child accumulates all permissions of the referenced role in addition to its own.

secureresource.title: SecureResource
secureresource.description: Represents a named resource subject to security controls, defining the operations that can be performed on it and optional field-level access restrictions. Acts as the resource component in subject-action-resource access control triples per NIST SP 800-53 AC-3.

type.description: Category of protected resource, used to apply appropriate access control and audit policies per NIST SP 800-53 AC-3.

securityconstraints.title: SecurityConstraints
securityconstraints.description: An aggregate container defining the procedural access control constraints for an application, grouping SeparationOfDuty, BindingOfDuty, and NeedToKnow rules. Applied within SecurityModel to enforce AC-5 and workflow integrity controls.

securitymodel.title: SecurityModel
securitymodel.description: The root aggregate for an application's security posture, composing authentication, authorization (roles, permissions, resources), threat model, data classification, accountability requirements, and policies into a unified security specification. Scoped to a single application or bounded context.

application.description: Name or identifier of the application this security model governs. Used to scope the security posture to a single application or bounded context.

accessControlModel.description: Access control paradigm in use: DAC (discretionary), MAC (mandatory), RBAC (role-based), ABAC (attribute-based), ReBAC (relationship-based). Per NIST SP 800-162 and SP 800-207.

securitypolicy.title: SecurityPolicy
securitypolicy.description: A named, prioritized security policy containing ordered evaluation rules that determine access control decisions for targeted resources or operations. Policies are evaluated in priority order with the highest-priority matching policy determining the outcome. Implements NIST SP 800-53 AC-1 policy requirements.

target.description: The category of entity this policy governs, aligned with XACML target element semantics.

requirementLevel.description: Compliance obligation of this policy, indicating whether enforcement is required by regulation, recommended best practice, or situationally applicable.

separationofduty.title: SeparationOfDuty
separationofduty.description: Enforces NIST SP 800-53 AC-5 by requiring that sensitive tasks (e.g., request + approval, initiate + authorize) are performed by different actors or roles, preventing fraud, collusion, and undetected errors. MutuallyExclusive indicates roles that cannot be assigned to the same individual.

threat.title: Threat
threat.description: Represents an identified security threat with assessed likelihood and impact, targeting specific resources or controls. Linked to Countermeasures that reduce exposure. Supports NIST SP 800-53 RA-3 risk assessment and enables residual risk tracking.

likelihood.description: Probability the threat will be exploited, per NIST SP 800-30 Table E-2.

impact.description: Potential adverse impact if the threat is realized, per NIST FIPS 199.

criticality.description: Combined severity rating reflecting both likelihood and impact for prioritization.

validationrule.title: ValidationRule
validationrule.description: Specifies data validation constraints for FieldAccessControl, defining allowed patterns, value ranges, or transformations applied when accessing protected fields. Prevents data corruption and enforces field-level integrity.

type.description: Validation mechanism type, per NIST SI-10 (Information Input Validation).

value.description: Validation constraint value whose meaning depends on `type`: a regex pattern string, a numeric range expression (e.g. '1-100'), a maximum character count, a pipe-delimited list of allowed enum values, or a custom expression string.

message.description: Human-readable violation message shown to the user or logged when this validation rule fails.

severity.description: Severity of a validation rule violation.
